file_content.text: I must admit, this task does seem near impossible.
Blaesus alone murdered so many of my people. To fight all the Children, and this Empire--who could help us?
We need more than just soldiers. To truly face the Empire, we'll need superior tactics, or technology.
Troops alone won't be enough.
True. But unless we get some soldiers, we won't last long!
There's a time and a place to seek help, and I believe we've reached it.
We need advice.
We must find an army the Empire can't possibly intercept, or predict.
Someone utterly unexpected.
Something new. Or, perhaps something old.
What of the Noetikons? The ancient Masters who taught you the shielding technique? Their knowledge and experience could guide us.
The Noetikons were lost when the Sith attacked me on Coruscant.
But they were destroyed.
Is there some way to speak to them again?
They're wise, certainly.
Nine Jedi Masters arguing isn't my idea of wisdom.
Oh no. Not them again.
We recovered the last fragments of the Noetikons, and our most gifted engineers have been reconstructing them on Tython.
They haven't responded to anyone, even the Council. But they may remember you.
I must go. Leave for Tython, and speak to the Noetikons. I hope their knowledge has survived.
May the Force be with you.
Even if we've won, we still face the Children of the Emperor, and the Empire itself. Where would we look for allies?
Blaesus was a Sith. He's dead, and the royal family is safe, but their soldiers weren't as lucky.
Jedi, quickly. You need to hear this.
Good to see you. My commanders and our droids routed an Imperial fleet near your position, but this report is--odd.
Our men had a dozen sudden power failures, a major communications fault. I'd call that sabotage.
I suspect I know who's behind it, but let me know what you find.
More traitors, maybe.
Stay alert and let me know if there's any more incidents.
So would I.
Sorry, Tai, you'll need to handle it.
I don't have time for this.
I sense a "Jedi business" explanation approaching.
Who'd you upset this time, Jedi? We scattered an Imperial fleet heading your way, but something's not right.
I've had mechanical failures, communication drops, you name it. Might be a rat in my fleet.
If any candidates spring to mind, I want their names.
More traitors, perhaps.
I take anyone, Jedi, sometimes I get bad apples.
There may be more such problems. Be vigilant.
Keep your eyes open.
So handle it, Captain.
Something's up, isn't it? Give me the full story later, I have a fleet to patch up. Signing off.
Wait, Master Syo's trying to get through.
Something's happening--ah, finally, Master Syo.
Thank the Force you're alright. The Empire has launched a devastating offensive. The galaxy is again at war.
Dozens of major systems are being invaded. An Imperial ambush almost broke the Republic fleet, and the Jedi--every hour, more are lost.
We managed to protect the Core Worlds, but the rest of the Republic is under fire.
The Empire never intended this peace to last.
The Imperials planned this.
The Republic won't survive another "peace treaty." We have to stand and fight.
So it's war.
If we don't counterattack immediately, the Republic is finished.
We must retaliate now!
Calm yourself! Attacking blindly would be suicide.
I need you. All of you. The Rift Alliance worlds are the only ones still standing strong.
We need you to--wait. I don't see the Erigorm representative. Is Blaesus alright?
I also have bad news. The Republic has been infiltrated....
There are traitors among us.
I was forced to kill Blaesus to save innocent lives....
He's dead.
Blaesus turned on me and had to be destroyed....
He betrayed my trust.
The Children of the Emperor. Now, of all times. You say they've hidden themselves in the Republic?
This "First Son" is able to completely mask the other Children from us.
My senses were blinded.
Hmm. That fills a void in our knowledge.
It sounds like you've come across the Children before.
Yes. Do you know of them?
These Children of the Emperor are an abomination.
And they must be destroyed.
Unfortunately, the Council knows little about them.
Several years ago, one of the Dark Council turned, and joined us. He brought valuable intelligence.
He mentioned these Children of the Emperor, but even the Dark Council only knew terrible rumors. We must be on our guard.
In the meantime, the Chancellor has invoked an ancient law giving Jedi Masters military authority. The Republic needs our leadership.
I am at your command.
The Children are the greater threat. If I catch their leader, I can unmask them.
I'm going after the First Son.
I agree. But without a way to detect these Children, we must face the Empire.
The Jedi are not the Chancellor's private army.
He can't just conscript us.
Our role is to protect the Republic, no matter the circumstances.
We can't win with the armies we have. The Republic needs powerful allies, and you have already proven you could lead them.
You and the Rift Alliance must search the galaxy. Seek out the strongest forces you can find, to strike back at the Empire.
You won't be alone out there, Jedi.
That's right! Manaan stands with you.
Aeten Two also. Whatever good it will do.
Balmorra will always be your ally, no matter what.
I'd rather follow someone I respect. Count me in, too.
We've come a long way together. Now it's time to use our strength.
I'm proud of you all.
We're decided, then.
So that's what it takes to win you over--the threat of galactic destruction.
It's about time.
We must begin our search for allies at once.
But we have a crisis to handle first. Access your briefing as soon as possible, and good luck.
